headline.main: Remains of Macedonians Found in Mass Grave

lead_paragraph: Human remains thought to be those of six Macedonian civilians killed during a six-month rebellion by ethnic Albanians were found today in a mass grave in the northwest, the police said. Exhumation work at the site, between the villages of Neprosteno and Dzepciste, began earlier in the day under the supervision of observers from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and NATO troops. Representatives of the United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague were also present.
abstract: Human remains thought to be those of six Macedonian civilians killed by ethnic Albanians are found in mass grave in northwest (S)
